question: From which among the following parts of the Jute crop, is the fibre obtained?
explanation:
Jute is fibre crop of hot and humid tropical regions. Jute plant grows to a height of 2 to 4 metres and it has a straight
stem with branching only near the top. The fibre is obtained from the stalk of the plant. The fibre is the inner bark or bast of the plant.
